ThingDef.label: cabbage
ThingDef.description: Cabbage is a vegetable of the species Brassica oleracea, the wild mustard plant, which is the exact same species of plant as cauliflower, kale, collard greens, and brocolli (among others). Cabbage is what results when a wild mustard plant is bred for the purpose of enhancing its terminal bud, which is called its "head." A cabbage's thick leaves are formed into this head on a short, thick stalk.
